content.description: A charged particle is released from rest in an electric field. After the particle has moved through a potential difference of <math alttext="delta uppercase V" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <mi>V</mi> </math>, the particle has speed <math alttext="lowercase v sub f" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>.
content.question: If the particle then moves through an additional potential difference of <math alttext="delta uppercase V" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <mi>V</mi> </math>, what would be the final speed of the particle?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator lowercase v sub f, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction with numerator lowercase v sub f, and denominator the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the square root of 2, end root, times lowercase v sub f" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of 2, end root, times lowercase v sub f" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
